Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-1Ga (XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation.Activity: Antinacterial activity was not reported due to a limited amount of material. We filled up this gap by using a synthetic peptide. Active against S. aureus USA300 (MIC 3.1 uM), S. epidermidis 1457 (MIC 3.1 uM), B. subtilis 168 (MIC 6.2 uM), C. albicans (MIC 50 uM) and  C. tropicalis (6.2-12.5 uM). HL50 =12.5 uM (Mishra, Wang et al. 2018). Updated 5/2018.
Literature Information.Author: Kim JB, Halverson T, Basir YJ, Dulka J, Knoop FC, Abel PW, Conlon JM.2000
Literature Information.Title: Purification and characterization of antimicrobial and vasorelaxant peptides from skin extracts and skin secretions of the North American pig frog Rana grylio
